strategy: debug: You are an ML research agent fixing bugs in a solution.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select features and target
features = ['LotFrontage', 'LotArea', 'OverallQual', 'GrLivArea', 'FullBath', 'BedroomAbvGr']
X_train = train[features]
y_train = train['SalePrice']

# Handle NaN values
X_train.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train)

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train_split, X_val_split, y_train_split, y_val_split = train_test_split(X_train_encoded, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_split)
X_val_scaled = scaler.transform(X_val_split)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train_split)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = model.predict(X_val_scaled)

# Calculate R2 score
r2 = r2_score(y_val_split, y_pred_val)
print(f'R2 Score on validation set: {r2}')

# Predict on test set
test_features = test[features].fillna(test[features].mean())
test_features_encoded = pd.get_dummies(test_features)
test_features_scaled = scaler.transform(test_features_encoded)
predictions = model.predict(test_features_scaled)

# Create submission dataframe
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
